Adaptive Or Rwd Nu Library One website, every device.

By Steven Bassett

Current condition

Responsive Layouts

The current design is set to center at a static width of 900px.

Screenshots of current layouts.

Depends on hover.

Web Performance

From Google Page Speed

“Home | Northeastern University Libraries” got an overall PageSpeed Score of 64 (out of 100).

Suggestion Summary

  • High priority. These suggestions represent the largest potential performance wins for the least development effort. You should address these items first: * Enable Keep-Alive, Optimize images, Combine images into CSS sprites
  • Medium priority. These suggestions may represent smaller wins or much more work to implement. You should address this item next: * Enable compression
  • Low priority. These suggestions represent the smallest wins. You should only be concerned with these items after you’ve handled the higher-priority ones: * Leverage browser caching, Defer parsing of JavaScript, Serve scaled images, Minify JavaScript, Minify HTML, Minimize request size, Specify image dimensions, Put CSS in the document head

Web Accessibility

View full report from Web Accessibility Evaluation Tool - WAVE 5.0

How can we respond?

Here are some basic thoughts on how we can approach making a more adaptive or responsive theme for our current drupal website.

Using the new digital repository site’s theme as the theme to port over to the Library site.

I would use a similar look and feel to design the new theme for the Digital Repository Service, then I could use that same theme to port over the same idea to the main library website.

Upgrade the base theme and then try replicating and modifing a new starter theme.

Looking at the base theme we have Zen version 7.x-3.1 base to the new 7.x-5.x base which has changed the theme framework to become more responsive. This may be the best solution. I would look at creating a local environment, a brand new starter theme and then begin recalculating the theme to follow the current layout, but adding alternative layouts.

Choose a new base theme?

I would be intereseted in looking at creating a new theme all together using Omega, Twitter Bootstrap or many other themes, but this would require more effort on our part.
